chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)
Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Scott Baillargeon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexander Scott Baillargeon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexander Scott Baillargeon was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Alexander Scott Baillargeon was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Alexander Scott Baillargeon was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 08/16/22 by 03:00 PM

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

3:36 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Alexander Scott Baillargeon. Defendant Alexander Scott Baillargeon in court. ADA Becker recites resolution. Court notes Warrant in 22JC4. Recess 03:44PM to speak with SRN. Back on Record 03:55PM. Court quashes warrant in case 22JC4 and sets hearing. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to AMENDED Count 1: Neglecting a Child- 948.21(3)(f), AMENDED Count 2: Possession of Amphetamine/ LSD/ Psilocin- 961.41(3g)(d), and Count 3: Possession of  THC- 941.41(3g(e). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 4. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

AMENDED Count 1: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 200 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample 

AMENDED Count 2: W/S 2 Years Probation 

- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Surcharge: Waived
- DNA Sample

Count 3: W/S 2 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Surcharge: Waived
- DNA Sample

Conditions of Probation: 

- AODA within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations
- Participate in Parenting Class and follow through
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Comply with Chips case 22JC4
- Contact with D.M.S pursuant to case 22JC4
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation on 08/16/22 by 03:00 PM 

Court approves Branch 3 to modify payment plans.

Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

- Defendant to test before release. Baseline.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cody. B and Chloe S. and for the contact order to be consistant with TPC order regarding D.M.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
